candidates.title: Were Will and Jaden Smith Killed in a Car Crash?
candidates.content:
Claim:
Actor Will Smith and his son Jaden Smith were killed in a car crash in December 2019.
Rating:
False
About this rating
In December 2019, social media users began encountering a post proclaiming that actor Will Smith and his son, rapper Jaden Smith, had "died in a crash after a "car and truck collision":
This post was a hoax, as neither Will nor Jaden Smith had died or been seriously injured in an automobile accident. Clicking through on the social media post led users to a rogue website which displayed a fake CNN video announcing the supposed "shocking" death of the Smiths (along with some other adult content):
The purpose of this hoax appeared to be to bait users into clicking to view the video as a means of driving them to malicious web pages, and to trick them into sharing the hoax post on social media in order to spread it further. Users are strongly advised not to visit to the website that underlies this hoax post and not to click on anything displayed there.
candidates.description: Fake death notices are often spread for malicious purposes.

result.explanation: The news caption's claim that Will Smith and his son Jaden Smith died in a car crash is explicitly contradicted by the provided article from Snopes.  Snopes directly addresses this claim, labeling it a hoax and providing details about how the false information was spread via social media and a malicious website. The article explicitly states that neither Will nor Jaden Smith died or was seriously injured in a car accident. Therefore, the caption is demonstrably false.
result.supporting_points: Source 1 (Snopes):  "In December 2019, social media users began encountering a post proclaiming that actor Will Smith and his son, rapper Jaden Smith, had "died in a crash after a "car and truck collision": This post was a hoax, as neither Will nor Jaden Smith had died or been seriously injured in an automobile accident."

final_result.explanation: Both the internal and external validation checks strongly indicate that the original caption is out of context. The internal check, with a confidence score of 10, points out a clear discrepancy: the image shows Will Smith and Jaden Smith alive and well at an event, directly contradicting the caption's claim of their death in a car crash.  The external check further reinforces this conclusion, achieving a confidence score of 10 by citing a Snopes article that explicitly debunks the false information about their deaths. Snopes, a reputable fact-checking website, confirms that the claim is a hoax and that neither Will nor Jaden Smith died or suffered serious injuries in any car accident.  There is no conflict between the internal and external assessments; both independently and decisively confirm the caption's falsehood and its lack of context relative to the image. The high confidence scores from both checks (10/10) leave no room for doubt. The caption is entirely fabricated and has no connection to the provided image.  The image content and the external verification from Snopes completely refute the caption's assertion. Therefore, the caption is definitively out of context.
final_result.validation_summary: Both internal and external validations strongly support the conclusion that the caption is completely out of context. The image shows Will and Jaden Smith alive, while the caption falsely claims their death in a car accident.  External fact-checking confirms the caption as a hoax.
